item.title: Coronavirus Chased Off Tourists---Locals Don't Want Them Ever Flocking Back
item.description: The bustle of visitors has disappeared from places such as Japan’s ancient capital of Kyoto—only to be replaced by dissension over whether they should ever be welcomed back.

item.title: LGBT Rights Are Flashpoint in Culture War Dividing Europe's East and West
item.description: Simmering cultural differences splitting Europe are flaring into an outright battle between the more conservative East and liberal West over issues of gender identity.

item.title: Israel-U.A.E. Diplomatic Deal Ratchets Up Tensions With Iran
item.description: Iran unleashed an angry broadside against the establishment of formal diplomatic relations between Israel and the United Arab Emirates, a deal signaling deeper cooperation between the Jewish state and Gulf Arabs to counter Tehran as it vies for regional influence.

item.title: Lukashenko Built Belarus in His Own Image. Now His Position Is Under Threat.
item.description: Protests and strikes are spreading after a disputed election in Belarus, threatening President Alexander Lukashenko’s grip on power in the former Soviet republic he has run since the fall of the Iron Curtain.

item.title: Lebanese Face Threat of Widespread Hunger After Beirut Explosion
item.description: In the wake of the massive blast that destroyed the grain silos storing most of the country’s wheat supplies and badly damaged the sea port through which 85% of its food imports arrive, a critical food shortage is bearing down.

item.title: U.S. Eyes New Phase of Syria Sanctions
item.description: The Trump administration is readying new rounds of sanctions against Syria, planning to expand its blacklist by focusing on financial-support networks outside the nation in a renewed effort to coerce Damascus into peace talks.

item.title: North Korea Harasses Defectors With Calls, Texts
item.description: Pyongyang is using its growing hacking prowess to track down and contact citizens who have escaped and gained prominence in the South.

item.title: In Mauritius, Islanders Count the Cost After Race to Siphon Oil From Stricken Ship
item.description: Rescue teams removed much of the fuel from the vessel, but the clean-up goes on.
